quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Giraffes and Giraffe
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, brain, stingray. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Two thirds of a sharks brain is dedicated to its sense of smell.
The zebra shark is very small and gentle and can be kept close to other fish.
Giraffes were once thought to be a cross between a camel and a leopard.
How many pounds of leaves can a giraffe consume daily?
Which of these sharks has a flat body like a stingray?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: angel shark

questions.question: About how many years have beagles been around?
Which of these is not a subspecies of giraffe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East African Giraffe

questions.question: This shark was believed to be extinct, until it was found on the coast of Japan in 1898.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: goblin shark

questions.question: Which shark is the fastest swimmer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mako shark

questions.question: The beagle was developed mainly for tracking what animal?
What group of dogs does the beagle belong to?
Giraffes need less sleep than nearly every other animal.
What is the common name for baby sharks?
How many recognized giraffe subspecies exist?
How long is a giraffes gestation period?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Goldfish and Beagle
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, weight, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A goldfish can reach a weight of almost 10 lbs (4.5 kg)
Goldfish can die from overeating.
Beagles are sometimes used for termite detection in Australia.
How long can a goldfish live in optimal conditions?
What type of coat do beagles have?
In what country was the goldfish first domesticated?
Which of the following cartoon dogs was a beagle?
What color goldfish were most prized by the Chinese royalty several centuries ago?
In Europe goldfish were first introduced to what country?
Are beagles easy to housebreak?
The beagle is not a good choice for a childrens pet because it is aggressive.
What is the typical lifespan of the beagle?
The world record for the oldest goldfish is 49 years.
Is it true that goldfish only have a 3-second memory?
The puggle is a mix between a beagle and what dog?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: North America and Animal
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, bird, silvertip. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The coyote lives in North America and also goes by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prairie Wolf

questions.question: This creature belongs to the rodent family and is covered in sharp spines or quills.
This bear, also known as a Silvertip bear, is native to North America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grizzly Bear

questions.question: What type of animal is the cottonmouth?
What color are wild goldfish?
These raptors are known for their unusually social behavior. They even hunt in groups while the majority of raptors are solitary hunters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harris Hawk

questions.question: This animal is the largest of the deer family and can be found in the northern parts of North America.
This mammal is known for its black fur with a white stripe and for its apparent odor.
This North American animal is at the top of the food chain in the arctic region.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polar Bear

questions.question: Which of these animals cannot be found in North America?
This bird is the fastest animal on the planet in its hunting method, the stoop.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peregrine Falcon

questions.question: The Barn Owl likes to sleep all day long.
How many species of skunk exist?
Red-tailed Hawks are hunted in the USA because of their frequent attacks on domestic animals.
Goldfish are good parents. They nurse and protect their young until they grow up enough to defend themselves.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Red Fox and Skunks
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, parts, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these coat colors is not found in wild Red Fox populations?
How many young skunks can be born in one litter?
Approximately how long is a Red Foxs gestation period?
Fox hunting was made illegal in the U.K. in 2005.
How much of an effective range do skunks odor glands have?
Do foxes hibernate in winter?
What is the top speed that the Red Fox can reach?
What do skunks eat in the wild?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is an adult male rooster known as?
How long is the Red Foxs lifespan in the wild?
How many subspecies of Red Fox are found in India?

options.text: None. Red Fox are not native to India.

questions.question: Which of these are eaten by the Red Fox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Sometimes skunks kill domestic animals.
Can skunks be trained to make good pets?
Is the Red Fox a protected species in most parts of the world?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Lions and Lion
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, chicken, breed. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following characters is a chicken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foghorn Leghorn

questions.question: Lions are inactive about 20 hours per day.
Approximately what amount of meat does an adult male lion’s diet require per day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15 lbs. (6.8 kg)

questions.question: Approximately how long is a lions gestation period?
What is the average lifespan of a lion in the wild?
The Silkie chicken is the newest known breed.
How many beats per minute does a chickens heart usually beat?
All domestic chickens can be traced back to which bird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Red Jungle Fowl

questions.question: Which of the following color of egg is incorrect for a chicken egg?
Like most mammals lions can only breed with one male ensuring that the offspring belong to just one male.
Most lions only survive in Africa. But a population of the much endangered Asiatic lion lives in India. How many estimated lions live in India as of 2007?
The lion is the largest member of the cat species.
Which of the following is not a breed of chicken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese Crested

questions.question: What is the average maximal speed a lion can reach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 35 mph / 56 km/h

questions.question: What is the word used for someone that is afraid of chickens?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Penguins and Species
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, mean, bears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The larger the penguin species, the colder the region in which it is found.
All penguins are found exclusively in the Southern Hemisphere.
A polar bear has white fur.
How many species of penguins live in warm or even tropical environments?
Do white lions exsist in the wild?
Where can the polar bear be found?
Polar bears are among penguins’ most dangerous natural enemies.
What does the word penguin mean?
Large penguins can dive nearly 2,000 feet.
What color is a polar bears skin?
Penguins secrete salt from their nostrils.
Fossil records have shown a species of giant penguin that once stood 4 feet high.
Approximately how many wild polar bears are estimated to live across the Arctic?
Which of these is the largest species of penguins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emperor Penguin

questions.question: Which of these animals is NOT a natural predator of penguins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polar Bear
